comment:
I hope you're brewing this one; it looks fantastic. Some of the Irish Red recipes out there include a bit of Munich or Vienna and I like the sound of that for a red.
Roasted malt is always the most distinct part of a good Irish Red to me. The best ones I can think of have this dry, roasty grain quality that I can't get enough of. Roasted malt always seems to need a month or two in the bottle to mellow out, in my experience, though.
